Unfortunately I have no idea what caused this.  I just found the exception stack 
trace in my log file a couple of hours after the error happened.  I will attach 
the complete stack, but here's the top frames:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.actions.SelectionConverter.codeResolve(SelectionConv
erter.java:144)
	at orx`g.eclipse.jdt.ui.actions.FindAction.run(FindAction.java:236)

Created an attachment (id=1075)
log file showing stack trace
guard the code against null pointer accesss

John could it be that you triggered a search from a Java file loaded from the 
repository. In this case the editor input isn't a compilation unit which lets 
the code resolve fail.

Line 144 contains the code

return codeResolve(getInput(editor), (ITextSelection)editor.getSelectionProvider
().getSelection());

It seems that the FindAction has called the SelectionConverter with a editor == 
null. Guarding against this doesn't make any sense.

Opened bug 18079 for guard against repository files

Moving to Daniel for comments

There's a remote possibility, but I don't recall trying to do this recently.  
Pressing F4 in a remote class does cause a NPE, but not the same as the one in 
this bug report.  I was certainly opening lots of editors on class files in 
remote JARs, which also aren't backed by IFile...  Also of possible interest, I 
always use the "show selected element only" mode in the java editor.

Happened because the actions itself were enabled on the remote editor.
This is now fixed/covered by 18079.

Verified that search actions are disabled if editor doesn't work on CU or class 
file.
